revised_title: The Royal Charter Storm of October 1859: Meteorological Observations and Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the Royal Charter Storm of October 1859, analyzing its meteorological observations and the impact of storms on the British Isles. The author highlights the importance of accurate meteorological records and the role of barometric pressure in predicting storms. The article also touches upon the influence of geographical features, such as mountain ranges, on wind direction and velocity.
